output.conclusion: This course has provided an in-depth exploration of advanced electrical measurement techniques, equipping you with the knowledge and skills to tackle complex measurement challenges in various electrical engineering applications.
output.introduction: Welcome to Advanced Electrical Measurements! This course delves into sophisticated techniques for precise and accurate electrical measurements, building upon fundamental concepts and exploring advanced instrumentation and methodologies.

chapters.description: Detailed analysis of systematic and random errors. Statistical methods for error propagation. Uncertainty estimation using Type A and Type B evaluations. Coverage factor and confidence intervals.
Principles of calibration. Hierarchy of standards. Calibration procedures for various instruments (e.g., multimeters, oscilloscopes). Traceability and accreditation.
Amplification, filtering, and isolation techniques. Analog-to-digital conversion (ADC) principles. Data acquisition systems (DAS) architecture and components. Sampling theorem and aliasing.

modules.moduleTitle: Fundamentals of Measurement and Error Analysis

chapters.description: Advanced bridge configurations (e.g., Kelvin double bridge, Wien bridge). Applications in resistance, capacitance, and inductance measurement. Error compensation techniques.
Characteristics of ideal and practical instrumentation amplifiers. Common-mode rejection ratio (CMRR) and its impact on measurement accuracy. Design considerations for high-precision amplification.
Principles of synchronous detection. Noise reduction techniques using lock-in amplifiers. Applications in measuring weak signals in noisy environments.

modules.moduleTitle: Advanced Measurement Techniques for Passive Components

chapters.description: DSO architecture and operation. Sampling rate, bandwidth, and memory depth considerations. Triggering modes and advanced analysis features (e.g., FFT, waveform math).
Principles of spectrum analysis. Resolution bandwidth (RBW) and video bandwidth (VBW) settings. Measurement of signal power, frequency, and distortion.
S-parameter measurements. Characterization of impedance matching networks and transmission lines. Time-domain reflectometry (TDR) for fault location.
Principles of operation and error analysis. Burden impedance and its impact on accuracy. Applications in high-voltage and high-current measurements.
Measurement of voltage sags, swells, and harmonics. Total harmonic distortion (THD) calculation. Power factor correction and energy efficiency analysis.
Principles of energy measurement. Active and reactive power measurement. Smart metering technologies and communication protocols.
Principles of operation for various sensors (e.g., temperature, pressure, strain). Signal conditioning and linearization techniques. Calibration and error compensation.
Introduction to LabVIEW and other virtual instrumentation platforms. Data acquisition and control using software-defined instruments. Graphical programming and user interface design.
Architecture and communication protocols for WSNs. Data aggregation and routing techniques. Applications in environmental monitoring and industrial automation.
